intro: Triplaris formicosa, commonly known as the ant-tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and small, palmate leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish flowers that are often visited by ants, which give it its common name. Triplaris formicosa is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, typically in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems where it is found.
